channel.title: Gickup on Gickup Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Gickup on Gickup Docs

item.title: Methods to install
item.description: Binary Download the latest release for your OS and architecture from Github and unpack it. Alternatively, you can copy the gickup binary to a directory from your $PATH variable, to use it globally. Linux/Mac 1./gickup conf.yml Windows 1gickup.exe conf.yml Docker You can grab the latest version of gickup from Github or Docker. Pure Docker 1docker pull buddyspencer/gickup 2docker run -d -v /path/to/conf.yml:/gickup/conf.yml buddyspencer/gickup Docker Compose If you prefer to use docker compose, grab the docker-compose.

item.title: Github
item.description: 1 github: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 user: some-user 5 username: your-user 6 password: your-password 7 ssh: true 8 sshkey: /path/to/key 9 exclude: # this excludes the repos "foo" and "bar" 10 - foo 11 - bar 12 include: # this includes the repo "foobar" 13 - foobar 14 excludeorgs: # this excludes repos from the organizations "foo" and "bar" 15 - foo 16 - bar 17 includeorgs: # this includes repos from the organizations "foo1" and "bar1" 18 - foo1 19 - bar1 20 wiki: true 21 starred: true token: your github token.

item.title: Gitea
item.description: 1 gitea: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 url: http(s)://url-to-gitea 5 user: some-user 6 username: your-user 7 password: your-password 8 ssh: true 9 sshkey: /path/to/key 10 exclude: # this excludes the repos "foo" and "bar" 11 - foo 12 - bar 13 include: # this includes the repo "foobar" 14 - foobar 15 excludeorgs: # this excludes repos from the organizations "foo" and "bar" 16 - foo 17 - bar 18 includeorgs: # this includes repos from the organizations "foo1" and "bar1" 19 - foo1 20 - bar1 21 wiki: true 22 starred: true token: your gitea token.

item.title: Gogs
item.description: 1 gitea: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 url: http(s)://url-to-gogs 5 user: some-user 6 username: your-user 7 password: your-password 8 ssh: true 9 sshkey: /path/to/key 10 exclude: # this excludes the repos "foo" and "bar" 11 - foo 12 - bar 13 include: # this includes the repo "foobar" 14 - foobar 15 excludeorgs: # this excludes repos from the organizations "foo" and "bar" 16 - foo 17 - bar 18 includeorgs: # this includes repos from the organizations "foo1" and "bar1" 19 - foo1 20 - bar1 21 wiki: true token: your gogs token.

item.title: Gitlab
item.description: 1 gitlab: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 url: http(s)://url-to-gitlab 5 user: some-user 6 username: your-user 7 password: your-password 8 ssh: true 9 sshkey: /path/to/key 10 exclude: # this excludes the repos "foo" and "bar" 11 - foo 12 - bar 13 include: # this includes the repo "foobar" 14 - foobar 15 excludeorgs: # this excludes repos from the organizations "foo" and "bar" 16 - foo 17 - bar 18 includeorgs: # this includes repos from the organizations "foo1" and "bar1" 19 - foo1 20 - bar1 21 wiki: true token: your gitlab token.

item.title: Bitbucket
item.description: 1 bitbucket: 2 - url: http(s)://url-to-bitbucket 3 user: some-user 4 username: your-user 5 password: your-password 6 ssh: true 7 sshkey: /path/to/key 8 exclude: # this excludes the repos "foo" and "bar" 9 - foo 10 - bar 11 include: # this includes the repo "foobar" 12 - foobar 13 excludeorgs: # this excludes repos from the organizations "foo" and "bar" 14 - foo 15 - bar 16 includeorgs: # this includes repos from the organizations "foo1" and "bar1" 17 - foo1 18 - bar1 url: if empty, https://bitbucket.

item.title: Onedev
item.description: 1 onedev: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 url: http(s)://url-to-onedev 5 user: some-user 6 username: your-user 7 password: your-password 8 ssh: true 9 sshkey: /path/to/key 10 exclude: # this excludes the repos "foo" and "bar" 11 - foo 12 - bar 13 include: # this includes the repo "foobar" 14 - foobar 15 excludeorgs: # this excludes repos from the organizations "foo" and "bar" 16 - foo 17 - bar 18 includeorgs: # this includes repos from the organizations "foo1" and "bar1" 19 - foo1 20 - bar1 token: your onedev token.

item.title: Sourcehut
item.description: 1 sourcehut: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 url: http(s)://url-to-sourcehut 5 user: some-user 6 username: your-user 7 password: your-password 8 ssh: true 9 sshkey: /path/to/key 10 exclude: # this excludes the repos "foo" and "bar" 11 - foo 12 - bar 13 include: # this includes the repo "foobar" 14 - foobar 15 excludeorgs: # this excludes repos from the organizations "foo" and "bar" 16 - foo 17 - bar 18 includeorgs: # this includes repos from the organizations "foo1" and "bar1" 19 - foo1 20 - bar1 21 wiki: true token: your onedev token.

item.title: Any
item.description: 1 any: 2 - url: url-to-any-repo 3 username: your-user 4 password: your-password 5 ssh: true 6 sshkey: /path/to/key 7 - url: can-also-be-a-local-path-to-a-bare-repo url: can be https, http or ssh. Could also be a local bare repository username: user that will be used for the clone process. password: password for said user. ssh: boolean value if the clone should be done via ssh. sshkey: if empty, it uses your home directories' .

item.title: Gitea
item.description: 1 gitea: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 user: some-nome 5 url: http(s)://url-to-gitea 6 createorg: true 7 visibility: 8 repositories: private 9 organizations: private token: your gitea token. You don't need one, if you backup only public repositories. token_file: alternatively, specify the token in a file, relative to current working directory when executed. url: if empty, https://gitea.com is used. user: the user/org you want to mirror the repositories to.

item.title: Gogs
item.description: 1 gogs: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 user: some-nome 5 url: http(s)://url-to-gogs 6 createorg: true 7 visibility: 8 repositories: private token: your gogs token. You don't need one, if you backup only public repositories. token_file: alternatively, specify the token in a file, relative to current working directory when executed. url: there is no default value. user: the user/org you want to mirror the repositories to. createorg: if activated, it will create the value in user as organization if it doesn't exist on the system.

item.title: Gitlab
item.description: 1 gitlab: 2 - token: some-token 3 token_file: token.txt 4 url: http(s)://url-to-gitlab token: your gitlab token. You don't need one, if you backup only public repositories. token_file: alternatively, specify the token in a file, relative to current working directory when executed. url: if empty, https://gitlab.com is used. A backup to Gitlab works in general. With the community edition, it just migrates the repository to Gitlab. Mirroring is only supported in the Enterprise Edition.

item.title: Local
item.description: 1 local: 2 - path: /some/path/gickup 3 structured: true 4 zip: true 5 keep: 5 path: path to store your backup If you use Docker, don't forget to mount the path of your backup! structured: if set to true, it checks out the repos in a more structured way, like hoster/user|organization/repository zip: zips the repository keep: keeps x latest backups
